title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
content: Wilfred Bonse, Governorship aspirant in the 2023 gubernatorial elections, Cross River State has been linked to Patricia hack. The hacker used him to launder the stolen funds.Quote from: https://x.com/PoliceNG/status/1727933517105873394?s=20Having registered his involvement in the complex crime. Wilfred Bonse, conspired in laundering the sum of Fifty Million Naira (N50,000,000:00k) originating from the fraudulent diversion of Six Hundred and Seven Million Naira (N607,000,000:00k) from Patricia Technology company's account to his bank account through a cryptocurrency wallet.To understand better:https://x.com/PoliceNG/status/1727933517105873394?s=20https://techpoint.africa/2023/11/24/arrested-wilfred-bonse-in-patricia-hack/https://cointelegraph.com/news/nigeria-patricia-technologies-relieved-as-arrest-made-in-crypto-wallet-heistFor more visibility, I am abandoning this thread: Patricia breached, bitcoin and naira stolen. Let us continue to discuss about Patricia hack on this new thread for more people to see it and also for us to avoid duplication.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 25, 2023, 01:18:32 PMWilfred Bonse, Governorship aspirant in the 2023 gubernatorial elections, Cross River State has been linked to Patricia hack. The hacker used him to launder the stolen funds.Thus shows the conplex nature of the Nigerian society and further stress the fact that most of the people into politics are people with criminal records; when they make money through illegal ways, they enter into politics to protect themselves. No wonder they used money to corrupt the electioneering process. Assuming WIlfred won the governship election of Cross Rivers State, he would have been enjoying full immunity by now and would have used money to kill this case. This Patricia hack was so painful, because Patricia was a promising company that have gained so much popularity after their sponsorship of the BBNaija. This made their use base to grow exponentially,  bringing in many celebrities and influential people into Bitcoin. Unfortunately,  this ugly incident happened and brought a bad image to cryptocurrency, confirming the fears of many critics. Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 25, 2023, 01:18:32 PMFor more visibility, I am abandoning this thread: Patricia breached, bitcoin and naira stolen. Let us continue to discuss about Patricia hack on this new thread for more people to see it and also for us to avoid duplication.I truly hope this matter is not buried under the carpet considering that the criminal enterprise of politics have been identified to be involved. They control everything and always find a way around our security and legal system.

comments.author: Makus
comments.body: Normally for corruption to die for this country, e no go easy, and no be today wey we don dey call our leaders say dem be thief, finally all our accusations to the government for involving in fraudulent activities has been made clear to us all, this na person wey be wan come out as governor of River state, wattin I never still understand na wattin be the worth of 50million for em side wey make am come destroy the name of crypto and that promising company so. I just dey thank God say dem catch am, so that the world go no say, some of our politicians dey involved with wattin dey make us get bad name. E fit even be say em dey sponsor boys to learn this hack, then come use am to em favour. I must confess that I am disappointed at Wilfred Bonse.

To me all these dubious politicians that have always been involved in frauds and money laundry should be brought to book and face the penalty of their crimes. Like these set of people are the ones tarnishing our image to the international community thereby making everyone look suspicious and has hindered the growth of our country because whenever the genuine ones are sorting for solution from the western countries they will feel that we want to use that avenue to defraud them thereby they might not really give us the benefit of doubt that we ain't really the way they paint us. Corruption needs to end now or else corruption might end the country. And these are the set of people that will never allow anything good to come to the people instead they will kick against it.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 25, 2023, 01:18:32 PMWilfred Bonse, Governorship aspirant in the 2023 gubernatorial elections, Cross River State has been linked to Patricia hack. The hacker used him to launder the stolen funds.While I am happy with this news that this crypto organisation startup has been vindicated I am however perplexed by the prime suspect that has been arrested. Who ever the hacker was, the person is both smart and dumb at the same time. Smart because he or they were able to notice the security loophole in Patricia infrastructure and took advantage of it, dumb because they used someone who is a public figure to launder the money.Well my happiness from this all is that Patricia's clients gets their funds back. I can imagine them withdrawing it at the speed of light. How can they get the trust and confidence of the Nigerian populace. This is going to be a hard one for them.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Omo this one na good news. I dey happy for Patricia, me self been think say the CEO know something about the stolen funds because of their Patricia token wey dem been wan give their customers. Now e good say we know the hack na real.Concerning the recent development, e show say the different address wey the hacker moved the funds to dey under surveillance, and I believe when Wilfred Bonse send the stolen funds to exchange wey him do KYC, na their them take know him identity. This news sweet me for belle and I dey look forward to next update from NPF. Hopefully, dem fit give us the identity of the hacker(s) and the arrest wey them don make

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Wow!!! a governorship candidate from Nigeria State? Is Patricia a Nigeria exchange company? wow!!! this information is telling me that Nigerian Politicians are fully aware of cryptocurrency and they are just hiden themselves. This is very bad of him. And this is most politicians are doing now. most of them are using cryptocurrency to hide their stolen funds. Me I never use am so I dey skeptical about the whole scenario and I been no dey follow up di news. And dis is a very bad image  Wilfred Bonse has created for himself in the political scene in Nigeria. And now that they caught this one, let them investigate and reveal all actors involved in the crime and persecute them.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Just like some of you people have said already that there are cases like this that might later die down. Let us hope it will not be like that. I wish the public to know who the real hackers are. In the world we are today, nobody will be able to do a business of huge amount of money with unknown person, I am believing that Wilfred Bonse will likely know the hackers. A politician will be smart to that extent and not foolish like some people that will not know the bad actor they are dealing with and yet linked to scam and unforseen consequences.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: Politics na safe haven for corrupt individuals, when dem don commit crime, launder money finish, na to come hide under the immunity of leadership to de enjoy dem loot. Dis na why corruption go hard to kill for our country, because who wan point fingers, wey who im de point sabi im own crimes.But my concern be say how di matter wan take end, if im get connection for where e matter, even if dem detain am, before you know dem go release am, case close and end of di matter. But if im be enemy of where matter, den im go go in for di crime, na so di matter be for naija.At least dis one don redeem Patricia, image small, so dem go leverage on did finding to get di sympathy of dem customers to continue with dem services.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on November 25, 2023, 01:18:32 PMWilfred Bonse, Governorship aspirant in the 2023 gubernatorial elections, Cross River State has been linked to Patricia hack. The hacker used him to launder the stolen funds.Believe that PR stunt at your own risk; it was an elaborate scam by Patricia to reopen their scam company and regain the faith of Nigerians. Only 50m has been traced as reported by the police, and Patricia has been cleared of all charges in less than 24 hours, yet her customer has yet to be refunded. Patricia should have been imprisoned and the company's working licence revoked in a working country.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: This Patricia matter just dey unfold every day. I saw the tweet few days ago from Patricia CEO and e no really convince me. It turns out a lot of people believed and collaborated their story of being hacked and hacked funds getting laundered by politicians forgetting that the company was excessively spending customers funds on ads and luxurious lifestyle.In all, the key takeaway is simply to stay away from them even if they relaunch because those who forget history are bound to repeat it.

Patricia should have been imprisoned and the company's working licence revoked in a working country. Who charges Patrica? I did not read anything about that. Very possible that the exchange may be under investigation, but I did not read anything about any charges. If I am wrong, you can give me a link.With how it has been, it is Patricia customers that are most likely to be in lawsuit with Patricia, but I did not hear anything about that.Why should Patricia owner (which I think you meant as Patricia) be imprisoned?Quote from: Obari on December 02, 2023, 05:12:52 AMNormally I never took this matter really serious because it looks more like a staged scenario and I agree with Ige that the  license would have been revoked in a working country which simply means that nothing is real in Nigeria especially if you have the money and this is Patricia toying with people’s money and I believe a lot of negative things must have happened in cause of all this dramas and you should know that with news and stories like this, it will be very difficult for people to accept crypto in a country like ours.Crypto is widely adopted in Nigeria. Most Nigerians are not even using exchanges that are in Nigeria, most Nigerians make use of foreign exchanges.Secondly, if the license of the exchanges that are hacked should be revoked, most known exchanges like Binance, OKX, Kucoin and most other exchanges licences should have been revoked because most exchanges have been hacked.Recently Poloniex and HTX (formerly known as Huobi global) were hacked. HTX was hack two times this year. Most well known exchanges that were hacked since 2020 were able to reopen after short period of time and refund their customers. I can blame Patricia because it has been long before the exchange open withdraw, and not yet to all his customers.But I know that if truly Patricia has paid all his customers, it would be declared in the public.

comments.created_time: December 03, 2023, 11:08:21 PMLast edit: December 04, 2023, 06:59:16 PM by Obari
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on December 03, 2023, 10:19:01 AMQuote from: Igebotz on December 03, 2023, 07:11:00 AMWhat evidence do you have that Patricia isn't a scam company? I once mentioned on this board how Patricia stole my $200 Steam card not once. Other of my colleagues too.I have friends that this happened to in other platforms. No one have the evidence that a site stole their gift card. As a Nigerian, I know what I am talking about. There are people that the gift card code is sent to them by someone else, not that they buy the card directly. Did you buy the card directly and sold it, or you were sent the card? I’m not trying to take sides but speaking from my experience as a gift card trader over some time now, I’ve noticed that most of the third party cards bought from the stores are mostly corrupted especially the steam cards and if in any case, your card gets marked as used without anyone using it, then it shouldn’t be a course for alarm as it must have been corrupted after activation without anyone actually using it and most times there are the google informative cards which can’t be redeemed by a third party and if maybe you aren’t satisfied with the response from Patricia, you can maybe track were your card was redeemed from the card providers official website.It has already taken Patricia so long to refund their customers funds to them and I thought they were supposed to refund every penny of their customers funds to them before been cleared of any charges
